intro: Pentameris reflexa, commonly known as the reflexed pentameris, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its fruit is a dry, two-valved capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
